poem:
### Watching

In the shadows, they stand,  
Cameras with eyes that pierce  
Through the heart of the crowd.  
Faces captured, unasked.  
The carnival moves on,  
Laughter entwined with fear.  
Silent judges, unseen,  
In a world drawn tight by lines  
Unseen, yet chilling—  
A tapestry woven  
Without consent or soul.
